ci_support_linux_64_python3.10.____cpyth:
c_stdlib:
- sysroot
c_stdlib_version:
- '2.17'
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cxx_compiler:
- gxx
cxx_compiler_version:
- '14'
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
numpy:
- '2'
pin_run_as_build:
  python:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
python:
- 3.10.* *_cpython
target_platform:
- linux-64
zip_keys:
- - python
  - channel_sources

about.description:
The cysgp4 package is a Cython-powered wrapper of the sgp4 C++ library
by Daniel Warner to compute satellite positions from two-line elements
(TLE). It provides similar functionality as the well-known sgp4 Python
package by Brandon Rhodes, which uses Numba internally to speed-up the
calculations. In contrast to sgp4, cysgp4 can work well with arrays of
TLEs and/or times and make use of multi-core platforms (via OpenMP) to
boost processing times a lot.
about.summary: Cysgp4 is a wrapper around the SGP4 package, for sat TLE calculations

name: cysgp4

about.description:
The cysgp4 package is a Cython-powered wrapper of the sgp4 C++ library
by Daniel Warner to compute satellite positions from two-line elements
(TLE). It provides similar functionality as the well-known sgp4 Python
package by Brandon Rhodes, which uses Numba internally to speed-up the
calculations. In contrast to sgp4, cysgp4 can work well with arrays of
TLEs and/or times and make use of multi-core platforms (via OpenMP) to
boost processing times a lot.
about.summary: Cysgp4 is a wrapper around the SGP4 package, for sat TLE calculations

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "cysgp4" %}
{% set version = "0.4.0" %}
{% set sha256 = "bb38659db575bddd8aae30c8e1cb8060a278ac06f867b2bd18e1b4ce483d8182" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.org/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/{{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: {{ sha256 }}

build:
  number: 1
  skip: true  # [py<=39]
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . --no-deps -vv

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ compiler('cxx') }}
    - {{ stdlib("c") }}

  host:
    - compilers  # [osx]
    - llvm-openmp  # [osx]
    - python
    - pip
    - setuptools
    - setuptools_scm
    - cython
    - extension-helpers
    - numpy

  run:
    - python
    - numpy
    - setuptools
    - compilers  # [osx]
    - llvm-openmp  # [osx]

test:
  imports:
    - cysgp4

  commands: python -c "import cysgp4; cysgp4.test()"

about:
  home: https://github.com/bwinkel/{{ name }}
  license: GPL-3.0 AND Apache-2.0 AND BSD-3-Clause
  license_file:
    - COPYING.GPLv3.txt
    - COPYING.Apache2
    - TEMPLATE_LICENCE.rst
  summary: Cysgp4 is a wrapper around the SGP4 package, for sat TLE calculations
  description: |
    The cysgp4 package is a Cython-powered wrapper of the sgp4 C++ library
    by Daniel Warner to compute satellite positions from two-line elements
    (TLE). It provides similar functionality as the well-known sgp4 Python
    package by Brandon Rhodes, which uses Numba internally to speed-up the
    calculations. In contrast to sgp4, cysgp4 can work well with arrays of
    TLEs and/or times and make use of multi-core platforms (via OpenMP) to
    boost processing times a lot.
  dev_url: https://github.com/bwinkel/{{ name }}

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - bwinkel

about.description:
The cysgp4 package is a Cython-powered wrapper of the sgp4 C++ library
by Daniel Warner to compute satellite positions from two-line elements
(TLE). It provides similar functionality as the well-known sgp4 Python
package by Brandon Rhodes, which uses Numba internally to speed-up the
calculations. In contrast to sgp4, cysgp4 can work well with arrays of
TLEs and/or times and make use of multi-core platforms (via OpenMP) to
boost processing times a lot.
about.summary: Cysgp4 is a wrapper around the SGP4 package, for sat TLE calculations
